The bed was very comfortable, the kitchen was modern, and parking was conveniently located in front of the courtyard entrance. Additionally, the location was perfect--centrally located and charming--and the price was beyond reasonable.
We wish we could have stayed longer and will definitely book again the next time we visit Elizabeth City!

May 2024
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Jonathan and Ivy are terrific hosts! They showed right away that they would be available to assist with any issues when we had difficulty with the electronic door lock. Jonathan arrived within minutes. :)
Anchors Away is a lovely historic house. It has a gracious front porch, a fenced yard with picnic table and grill, and is in a walkable historic neighborhood. The kitchen has been nicely remodeled with new appliances and all the necessary cookware and dinnerware. The bathrooms have a vintage look but the plumbing is definitely modern â€” plenty of hot water and no rattling pipes. All of the furnishings are comfortable. The entire house was nicely decorated, tidy, and clean.
Elizabeth City is a cute small city with a modest waterfront park, a boardwalk along a creek, and possibly the most diverse collection of historic architecture Iâ€™ve ever seen in a small city. There are numerous walking tours to enjoy, and plenty of restaurants and a great wine bar to stop at along the way.

review_text: Everything looked good and we were happy with our stay. Only two thing stood out to us at checkin, which was the downstairs bathroom had a door accessible to the outside, which the bottom lock didn't work, but they had a deadbolt that did and a old leak in the first bedroom. None of that was a real issue for us. Overall, we were satisfied with our stay. I would just suggest you record your checkin and checkout and be sure to get the ceiling. I made that statement due to a message I received after checkout from the co-host Jonathan. He reported there was some damage "quite a bit of stains and broken ceiling fan globe," and he planned to request $50 to cover the globe and extra cleaning. I inquired about proof of damages because I was unaware of damages. We didn't use any of the three ceiling fans due to the weather, and I didn't know about stains. I requested proof, and he stated he would send proof in the morning when he requested the $50. It's has been 14 days, and still nothing.

Stayed about a week
review_text: We (6 people) spent a week in Elizabeth City (October)--as a home base for things in the area. We arrived Saturday evening, later than planned but everything was easy. The keycode entry pad was well illuminated, and the instructions from Ivy easy to follow. Parking right infront of the house was always easy. When we got inside we were all pleasantly surprised. Very clean, the pictures on the website matched what we found--everything tidy and clean with lots of space. The walls (a very nice green) harmonized well with the hard wood floors. And the kitchen / eating area...a LOT of space...with a large marble cooking island in the middle, gas stove, well stocked kitchen (i.e. cooking utensils, pots and pans and baking dishes, coffee maker, etc. although two pans were on their last legs)--definitely a great space (and large table) for people who like to cook and sit together at meals. Everything else in the house was...clean and tidy, a big TV in most every room, towels, a great place.

review_text: This place is newly renovated and so cute inside. Very clean, smells great. The kitchen is excellent and well-stocked. We only stayed for an evening as we were traveling through, but a lot of info was provided on the town - seems like a fun place and not far from some great coastal adventures. The hosts were super responsive, not that we needed anything. Comfy beds and quality linens and towels. We had a full house and while we all fit it might be a bit tight for a longer stay. Friends with nicer cars commented on the street only parking, but the neighborhood seems fine despite the area you drive through to get there. The houses are very close together so mind the blinds when changing! I would stay again - we even considered asking for an extra day since we were so tired and so close to the rover and beaches with wild horses!

Elizabeth City is nice and quiet, though we weren't too used to navigating around town, but that's part of the adventure when we visit new places. The beds were very comfortable and all 6 six of us slept well in a cozy and well ventilated house. Jonathan's spouse, Melissa was able to take care of our wifi issue swiftly, which was very much appreciated because the younger children wouldn't let up about needing wifi access as soon as we stepped foot into the house. She was also so kind to sweep the water that had collected on the front porch after the rain, shortly upon our arrival. Thank you, Melissa! Overall, pleasant experience and we would definitely recommend "Anchors Away" for your stay in NC!! :)

review_text:
The house is spectacular. It is very tastefully decorated and spotless. We liked that there was a full bathroom on the first floor in addition to the full bathroom on the second floor. We had 6 adults in our party and we all took showers In the morning. There was plenty of hot water. The beds were very comfortable and the two bigger rooms had ceiling fans. The smaller room (which consisted of a single bed and bunk beds) had a floor fan. The neighborhood was very quiet.
Our hosts had bottled waters for us in the refrigerator. There was also a tea and coffee station. The kitchen was essentially stocked. We chose to have dinner out the evening we stayed. There were several places to choose from. Ivy & Johnathan have provided recommendations in their welcome binder. Speaking of the hosts, communication was very, very timely.

The house was super clean and we really enjoyed the sun room. This was a great weekend getaway. We also loved that we were able to bring our four legged friends. The only thing we were a little disappointed in was the fenced in backyard. The very back part of the fence along the tree line/swamp had started falling down. We did not feel comfortable leaving our dogs in the backyard without full supervision just because we were afraid they would possibly escape where the fence has started to fall in the back part along the tree line. If you have really small dogs, this may not be a concern for you. We were still able to let our dogs roam freely in the backyard and play fetch, we just didnâ€™t fully trust the fence security along the backstretch.

Stayed one night
review_text:
This is a difficult review to write since Alice tried to accommodate us, and we didn't really get a chance to talk with her as some of her guests seem to have. I selected her place based on the availability of a hot tub at a waterfront location, so it was a big disappointment that it was not working. We were not notified of that in advance, or I would have asked to cancel. Alice was apologetic when she heard the hot tub was important to us, and when asked, she did provide a partial refund of the nightly cost.
Our 1st floor unit was comfortable, but it felt more like visiting mom's (off-white reclining sofas with drink holders, figurines in cabinets, etc.). The kitchen is well supplied: there's even Christmas china. The 2nd floor unit was also rented, and we heard them...
Unfortunately, the fees associated with this Airbnb are very high, and given the pricing, we expected more. All in all, we could have stayed somewhere much nicer for less than the total cost, even after the refund.

Alice lives next door and is welcoming, happy to help, is willing to share stories and history with you, but also gave us all the privacy we could hope for.
Highly highly recommend!
The only word of caution I might have is, the place is literally right on the water, and there is no railing around to prevent a young child from going over the edge. So, if you have young ones, you'll need to pay close attention. We loved this though, as we were able to sit on the edge and dangle our feet.

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Alice was great! This place is really beautiful and we loved our stay.
- WIFI - works well, I did work from the place for two days. Really strong connection
- Bed- on the firm side, really large and comfortable. all cotton sheets and blankets
- Bathroom- decent pressure, had soap, tissues and 100% cotton towels. Good size shower - works for tall people
- the space is larger than it seems in the pics and even though it's a studio the kitchen is separate from the bed and living room. Beautiful finishes and really a comfortable place. I wish we had more time there!
- full kitchen - basic utensils and a few pots and pans
-the view- THE VIEW! It's breathtaking. Alice really does an amazing job keeping this place pristine - we didn't have issues with spiders or bugs outside, it was comfortable, private and you feel like you are in the country when you are in the middle of everything. Small town but perfect place to getaway and relax.

review_text: My husband and I just left Jasper's cottage on October 1st, 2023, after staying 2 nights. I must say, we had an enjoyable and peaceful stay. Jasper provided clear instructions on how to work the keyless lock to get into the home. Once we took our time to press the numbers on the keyless entry, we were able to get in and out with no problems. The kitchen is very spacious and Jasper had everything you needed from cleaning supplies to shampoo and any other amenities to make the stay comfortable. There is not a TV in the bedrooms which i thoughtvwas going to be a problem for me as I am used to watching TV to go to sleep, but believe it or not I was able to sleep like a baby. The bed was so comfortable as it was very soft and easy to rest on. The second bedroom did not have a closet but that was okay as the master bedroom has a huge closet space for both bedrooms. The stay was wonderful and less than 2 minutes to get into the city area of Elizabeth City.

The kitchen/living room area is upstairs which helped give the open bedroom a feeling of quiet privacy, and the bed was so comfortable! The kitchen is an absolute dreamâ€¦ full oven/range, full refrigerator, well stocked pantry, a toaster and a microwave, and donâ€™t even get me started on how in love I am with the coffee maker. It truly has everything you could need and more. Traveling as folks with dietary restrictions is often challenging, especially in smaller towns, so it was really nice to be able to prepare meals. There are shops, breweries, restaurants, and coffee shops all within a short walk of the apartment. We felt very safe coming and going regardless of time of day. Street parking was easy to find and free of charge. Would absolutely stay here again!

review_text:
Even though it was a colder and rainier weekend than would be ideal for a houseboat stay, we still had a great time. Mechelle is very communicative and accommodating. The parking situation on the weekend was a breeze (the lot next to the boats wasnâ€™t too hard to find), even at night. Also FYI thereâ€™s a bit of a gap (as normal) stepping onto the boat, so if you were mobility challenged this might be a consideration (also I can see this leading to some interesting outcomes if you were to have a few too many at one of the nearby bars or restaurants haha), but that wasnâ€™t a big deal (again, as is pretty normal with boats).
The boat itself was lovely. Very clean and well kept, nice places to sit in the common area, a perfectly usable (if a bit small) kitchen area, and two bedrooms (one of which is a walkthrough where the bathroom is located) with quite comfortable beds. There are portable and over-head heating units, so even though it was chilly outside, we were perfectly fine.
Finally, the best part are the two patios: the front and the top of the boat. (Thereâ€™s also an outside area at the back of the boat, but not really a place to sit- it mostly serves as the place where the ladder is to the top patio). Both very lovely and so pleasant to sit outside with coffee or wine and read or think or work or chat.
Would definitely recommend!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
If you are reading this review to decide whether or not to book "Island Time" for your next get-away, DO IT!!! This place is amazing in every way and is perfect for a romantic couples trip or even a solo or girls trip to seek solace from the hustle and bustle of real life. Island Time offers river front living on the cutest house boat you can imagine. The host has thought of absolutely everything to make you feel comfortable and at home on her boat. Everything is sparkling clean and the bed linens and towels are super high quality and just beautiful...not to mention the beautiful splashes of beach color everywhere you turn. The interior looks like something out of a magazine but still has that cozy/comfortable feel.
The activities are endless if you can't sit still like me. You can kayak, rent SUPs, swim, bike, stroll through downtown Elizabeth City and look at the beautiful historic homes, or walk to a great brewery or several great restaurants. If you are the sitting and relaxing type, you can sit on the top deck and sip coffee or wine for hours and enjoy the beautiful river views and sunsets.
What really makes this place stand out (outside of it's super cute and clean interior, great near-by attractions and reasonable price) is the host. I have stayed in many, many airbnbs and have had many great experiences, but this host wins the award for hospitality. She is AWESOME in every way. We will be going back soon and often.

review_text: Tammy's BnB on Church Street in Elizabeth City surpassed our expectations. The house is in a residential area, so we didn't expect (or want) a luxury beachside rental with all the unnecessary bells and whistles. What we got was a beautiful, spotless home that exuded peacefulness. This is an older home that has been upgraded without losing any of its original charm. It was equipped with everything we needed for our two-week stay. The furniture was comfortable and relaxing, and the decor was spot-on. It seemed as if every day we discovered something new that was so impressive. Tammy got the big picture right, but she also paid close attention to the little details that make a surprising difference. We did not want to leave!

Group trip
review_text: WOW! WOW! WOW! What a wonderful place in a wonderful location with a wonderful host. The pictures do not do the Loft Gardens any justice. When we arrived we were given a tour and all the details we needed for our stay. This location is ideal for all ages honestly! There is a little of everything to do near the area. I didn't want to leave the house because of how beautiful and spacious it is in there. It's very open and airy but cozy at the same time. There is a lot of art and knick knacks to look at as well as books that might peak your interest. The furniture is a really good mixture of modern/sheek/antique. We stayed in the Master Bedroom and I fell in LOVE with the bathroom because of the sky light, greenery and all the other elements. I could go on and on about this home so I will end with this, We had a large family group staying with us and there were enoughs beds and rooms for everyone. There were plenty sheets, towels, blankets etc. We had everything we needed! There are several restaurants' on the same block and right behind is a alleyway where patrons eat drink and be merry so if you are staying in the master you will hear them until about 2 am, but its not overly loud so it didn't really bother us. One last thing, we had the opportunity to eat at Island Breeze caribbean Restaurant and the food was amazing!

The Lofts are located right near the river in downtown Elizabeth City. There are lots of interesting bars and restaurants right nearby. The Museum of the Albemarle is just down the street. We went to the Outer Banks for a day trip, the drive is about 45 minutes. Plenty of things to explore!
Highly recommended.

name: Maggi
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

December 2021
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Our family gathered central distance from Raleigh NC and Charlottesville VA to have a few days together between Christmas and the New Year. The Loft Gardens was festively decorated for the holidays, and we were provided with everything we could possibly need during our stay. We chose it for its accommodating size and historic downtown location. The area was great for walking and exploring . . . river waterfront, a nice variety of good restaurants, The Museum of the Albemarle, a waterfront park where we saw older people fishing from the shore, families feeding the seagulls and a play area for the children. We even located a skateboard park for the teenagers. There is a history lesson here too. The families of the earliest settlers in our country, between Jamestown and Roanoke Island, gradually moved inward and founded this small town between the Pasquotank River and The Great Dismal Swamp. I am encouraged to spend time discovering our small towns during these years of the pandemic.

review_text: Doris is an excellent host! The loft is a gem and it vastly exceeded our expectations. We were blown away by how spacious and clean it was. It was clear to us that Doris and her team take great pride in setting up the place as comfortably as can be for guests. From the wonderful kitchen, large living room and dining areas, multiple bathrooms and great laundry room, the loft is truly a great place to stay for a family vacation. The generous amounts of clean linens, towels and other supplies made the place feel like being in a five-star hotel. The loft is in a quiet area and from there it's an easy drive to the Outer Banks. Doris takes her hosting responsibility very seriously. She was always available, day and night, to answer any questions we had. She even came up to the loft late one night to help us out when we couldn't figure out how to work an appliance. My family and I rated the place an 11 on a scale of one to 10! We highly recommend the loft! Thank you, Doris, for making our stay so memorable!

name: Lara
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
August 2018
,
Â·
Group trip
review_text: My family rented this amazing loft on our way to vacation in the Outer Banks. In the past, we have stayed in hotels, but have grown to enjoy renting from Airbnb. This is our favorite rental to date. It is a New York style loft above an amazingly cool restaurant. The restaurant delivered food for us right to the loft. It was delicious and plentiful. We were also gifted two bottles of wine to drink at dinner, which we greatly appreciated. Each of the ensuite bedrooms are beautiful with lovely linens and furnishings. The pillows are high quality. The kitchen, which we didnâ€™t use, is a chefâ€™s dream. The amenities are fantastic. There are soft fluffy towels and baskets of high end toiletries in each bathroom. The sofas are exceptionally comfortable, and fold out to make double beds. The dining table is large enough to seat our group of ten. You can walk out onto the roof, and look out over the city. There are two balconies which look over several small outdoor patios/pubs. In the evening, the entire back alley was lit with white lights and you could see people enjoying the evening. When we return, we are planning on partaking in this nightlife, as well as investigating the lovely downtown area. The space is immaculate, stylish and warm. The elevator was so helpful for my mom who is handicapped. In fact, my mom wanted to just stay there for the entire week instead of going to our vacation house. Doris was awesome in her communication and generosity. We are planning on making this a yearly tradition. It was truly magical. Cannot recommend it enough.

review_text:
We rented Doris' place to accommodate a team of lawyers during a week-long federal trial. We could not have been more comfortable or made to feel more welcome by Doris! The loft is more beautiful in person, it's open and spacious, comfortable, and homey. The large open area was perfect for late night planning and large group dinners. Each bedroom has its own private bath which was also perfect for us as colleagues. Each bath had a complimentary basket of travel necessities which came in handy more than once.
From check-in to check-out Doris was fully available via text message and quick to respond to any questions or needs we had. The home was stocked with beverages and wines and that was a welcome surprise!
Our week was fabulous and we'd recommend Loft Gardens to anyone visiting Elizabeth City! It's within walking distance to pretty much anything and plenty of delicious places to eat - including Doris' Island Breeze (SO YUMMY!) which is right down stairs.
We can't thank Doris enough for such a fabulous and comfortable week!

Loved that she had cable tv and ability for other. Alice is a wonderful hostess, very friendly, helpful and personable. Lots of good suggestions and great conversations with her. The property has a big dock that you can fish and swim from on both sides/fire pit. Very quiet neighborhood, river front , beautiful sunrise/sunsets from the deck settee or the dining area. Comfy bed, the bath with a tub with a view is amazing and a shower too! Just what we needed. Loved that there was a washer and dryer in the unit too. The Kitchen is very well appointed and has everything you need to cook anything. We will definitely be back soon! Thank you Alice for making our vacation awesome!
K & D

Alice also provided bicycles we used several times for the short ride to downtown. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. Elizabeth City may be one of the best kept secret destination spots in Eastern NC. And Alice's place is a great place to stay!

review_text: Alice was an excellent host, being responsive to our questions and providing a marvelous stay. It was ready on time, access was easy and it was very clean. Alice was able to provide some excellent suggestions, especially for what to do for Sunday night dinner (Coinjock Marina, worth the 30 minute drive), when many of the better places in town are closed. The property is on the Pasquotank River in Elizabeth City, and we had no trouble parking our kayak trailer. Access to the river was a primary amenity we were looking for and this property has great access to the river, with multiple docks with ladders and seating on the docks as well. The breeze was amazing, especially as our unit was on the 2nd floor. We will be staying here next time we come to Elizabeth City!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
A truly lovely and unique place. You are right on Albemarle Sound . You wake up with the rising sun dancing on the ceiling reflected off the water that is at your front door. Have tea on the front porch trying to guess what king of fish just jumped and splashed. In the evening you see the shadow of the fading sun travel across the sound and night envelope you like a childhood blanket.
I needed some R&R between high energy tech jobs and found it. Also there are some great moderately priced golf courses in the area.

review_text: Alices home was a delightful, picturesque slice of heaven. Like being on a private island or in your own lighthouse, water views from so many windows. The home is clean, comfortable, stylish, and quiet. The Wi-Fi was fast And all appliances worked perfectly. The listing mentions it is not suited for young children because of the deep water access. For all others, your search is over. Look no further. Booking this vacation property is a win! You will be very lucky if you find that it is available. And, during the current times, having a home so clean and sanitized provides you with a very cool way to self isolate and take a little break from the outside world. Thank you again for hosting me and I have saved your listing and hope to return!!

review_text: This place is BEAUTIFUL!! And at an unbeatable price! The entire place felt very spacious even though it is essentially a studio apartment. The host Alice was very kind and was ready to help at any given moment. I would be remiss if I didnâ€™t think to tell future travelers that the host did not seem too worried about COVID-19. However the place was sparkling clean, the space was private, and Iâ€™m sure Alice would gladly wear a mask if asked to, as her intent to make us as comfortable as possible was clearly indicated time and time again. Overall, I was pleasantly shocked at the quality of my stay. A gorgeous area, a beautiful place, and a lovely host! This was my best Airbnb experience to date. My partner and I will definitely be renting this exact place in the future.
